Uses of Class
com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.features.AbstractFeature

  • Packages that use AbstractFeature 
    Package Description
    com.joliciel.talismane.languageDetector
    A package for training a language detector, based on a set of corpora, one per language, with one sentence per line.
    com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.features
    Generic features for use with Talismane machine learning, enabling various logical, mathematical and string manipulation functions in these features.
    com.joliciel.talismane.parser.features
    Various features specific to the dependency parsing phase.
    The available feature descriptors are listed in ParserFeatureParser.addFeatureClasses(com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.features.FeatureClassContainer)
    com.joliciel.talismane.posTagger.features
    Various features specific to the pos-tagging phase.
    The available feature descriptors are listed in PosTaggerFeatureParser.addFeatureClasses(com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.features.FeatureClassContainer)
    com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceDetector.features
    Features specific to sentence detection.
    The available feature descriptors are listed in SentenceDetectorFeatureParser.addFeatureClasses(com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.features.FeatureClassContainer)
    com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.features
    Features specific to the tokenisation phase.
    The available feature descriptors are listed in TokenPatternMatchFeatureParser.addFeatureClasses(com.joliciel.talismane.machineLearning.features.FeatureClassContainer)

      class  AbstractCachableFeature<T,Y>

      Returns the wrapped literal.
      class  IntegerToDoubleFeature<T>
      Converts an integer feature to a double feature
      class  InverseFeature<T>
      Inverts a normalised double feature (whose values go from 0 to 1), giving 1-result.
      class  IsNullFeature<T>
      Returns true if a feature is null, false otherwise.

      An external resource feature for an external resource with multiple classes per key.
      class  NormaliseFeature<T>
      Changes a numeric feature to a value from 0 to 1, where any value <= minValue is set to 0, and any value >= maxValue is set to 1, and all other values are set to a proportional value between 0 and 1.
      class  NotEqualsOperator<T>
      Returns operand1 != operand2.
      class  NotFeature<T>
      Reverses a feature using a boolean NOT.
      class  NullIfBooleanFeature<T>
      If the condition returns true, return null, else return the result of the feature provided.

      If the condition returns true, return null, else return the result of the feature provided.
      class  NullToFalseFeature<T>
      If the wrapped boolean feature returns null, will convert it to a false.
      class  OnlyTrueFeature<T>
      If the wrapped boolean feature returns false, will convert it to a null.
      class  OrFeature<T>
      Combines two boolean features using a boolean OR.
      class  OrFeatureAllowNulls<T>
      Combines two or more boolean features using a boolean OR.
      class  PlusIntegerOperator<T>
      Returns operand1 + operand2.

      Returns operand1 + operand2.

      Returns true if the first string feature starts with any of the other string features.
      class  StringInSetFeature<T>
      Returns true if the first string feature is in the set defined by the remaining string features.

    • Uses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.parser.features

      Subclasses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.parser.features 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AddressFunctionBuffer
      Retrieves the nth item from the buffer.
      class  AddressFunctionDep
      Retrieves the nth dependent of the reference token.
      class  AddressFunctionHead
      Retrieves the head (or governor) of the reference token.
      class  AddressFunctionLDep
      Retrieves the left-most left-hand dependent of the reference token.
      class  AddressFunctionOffset
      Retrieves the token offset from the current token by n (in the linear sentence), where n can be negative (before the current token) or positive (after the current token).
      The "current token" is returned by the address function.
      class  AddressFunctionRDep
      Retrieves the right-most right-hand dependent of the reference token.
      class  AddressFunctionSequence
      Retrieves the nth pos-tagged token in the sequence of tokens.
      class  AddressFunctionStack
      Retrieves the nth item from the stack.
      class  AncestorSearchFeature
      Looks at all of the ancestors of a given reference token in sequence, and returns the first one matching certain criteria.
      class  BackwardSearchFeature
      Looks at all pos-tagged tokens preceding the reference token in sequence (starting at the one closest to the reference token), and returns the first one matching certain criteria.
      class  BetweenCountIf
      Returns the number of pos-tagged tokens between two pos-tagged tokens (and not including them) matching a certain criterion.
      class  DependencyCountIf
      Returns the number of dependents already matching a certain criterion.
      class  DependencyLabelFeature
      The dependency label of a given token's governing dependency, where the token is referenced by address.
      class  DependencyLabelSetFeature
      A StringCollectionFeature returning all of the dependency labels in the current transition system.
      class  DependencySearchFeature
      Looks at all of the refernence token's dependencies in left-to-right sequence, and returns the first one matching certain criteria.
      class  DistanceFeature
      Returns the distance between the token referred to by addressFunction1 and the token referred to by addressFunction2, as an absolute value from 0 to n.
      class  ForwardSearchFeature
      Looks at all pos-tagged tokens following the reference token in sequence, and returns the first one matching certain criteria.
      class  ImplicitAddressFeature
      Simply returns the PosTaggedTokenWrapper that was passed in in the first place.
      class  StackSearchFeature
      Looks at all items on the stack above a certain index, and returns the first one meeting a criterion.
      class  TokenSearchFeature
      Returns the first token in a given range which matches a certain criterion, or null if no such token is found.
      If a start index is provided as a second argument, will start looking at this index.
      If an end index is provided as a third argument, will continue until the end index.
      All indexes must be <= the current history size, otherwise only valid indexes will be looked at.
      If start index >= end index, will look backwards, otherwise will look forwards.
      A stopCriterion can be provided, in which case the search will stop as soon as the stop criterion is hit.
      class  ValencyByLabelFeature
      Returns the number of dependents for a given head and label.
      class  ValencyFeature
      Returns the number of dependents.

    • Uses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.posTagger.features

      Subclasses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.posTagger.features 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractLexicalAttributeFeature<T>
      For a given set of lexical attributes, returns one String per combination found in a lexical entry associated with this pos-tagged token.
      class  AbstractLexicalAttributesFeature<T>
      For a given set of lexical attributes, combines all values found in the lexicon into a single String.
      class  AbstractPosTaggedTokenAddressFunction
      An empty abstract class for easily creating address functions.
      class  AbstractPosTaggedTokenFeature<T,Y>
      An Abstract base class for features applied to a given pos-tagged token.
      class  AbstractPosTaggerFeature<T>
      An Abstract base class for features which depend on the current PosTaggerContext, that is, the history of decisions already taken by the POS tagger.
      class  AllLemmasFeature<T>
      All of the lemmas for a given pos-tagged token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  AssignedPosTagFeature<T>
      The pos-tag assigned to a given token.
      class  AssignedPosTagInFeature<T>
      Is the pos-tag assigned to this token one of the given list.
      class  ClosedClassFeature<T>
      Whether or not the pos-tag assigned to this token is a closed-class category.
      class  CombinedLexicalAttributesFeature<T>
      For a given set of lexical attributes, combines all values found in the lexicon into a single String.
      class  GrammaticalCaseFeature<T>
      The grammatical case of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  GrammaticalGenderFeature<T>
      The grammatical gender of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  GrammaticalNumberFeature<T>
      The grammatical number of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  GrammaticalPersonFeature<T>
      The grammatical person of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  HistoryAbsoluteAddressFunction
      Returns a pos-tagged token from the current history by its absolute index in the sentence.
      class  HistoryCountIfFeature
      Counts the pos-tagged tokens within a certain range matching a certain criterion.
      The range is given in absolute indexes.
      If start > end, returns null.
      If no end is provided, assumes it should go till end of the current history.
      class  HistoryHasFeature<T>
      Checks whether a given pos-tagged token meets a certain criterion.
      class  HistorySearchFeature
      Returns the first token in a given range which matches a certain criterion, or null if no such token is found.
      If a start index is provided as a second argument, will start looking at this index, otherwise at the current token's index-1.
      If an end index is provided as a third argument, will continue until the end index, otherwise until token 0.
      All indexes must be <= the current history size, otherwise only valid indexes will be looked at.
      If start index >= end index, will look backwards, otherwise will look forwards.
      class  LemmaFeature<T>
      The first lemma (where first is arbitrary, but will always be the same for a given word form) of a given pos-tagged token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  LexicalAttributeFeature<T>
      For a given set of lexical attributes, returns one String per combination found in a lexical entry associated with this pos-tagged token.
      class  LexicalCategoryFeature<T>
      The main grammatical category of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  LexicalSubCategoryFeature<T>
      The grammatical sub-category of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  MorphologyFeature<T>
      The detailed morpho-syntaxic information of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  NgramFeature
      Retrieves the tags assigned to the previous N tokens.
      Will only return results if the current index >= N-2 (to avoid multiple start tokens).
      This ensures that we don't repeat exactly the same information in 4-grams, trigrams, bigrams, etc.
      class  PossessorNumberFeature<T>
      The grammatical number of the possessor of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  PosTaggedTokenAddressFunctionWrapper<T> 
      class  PosTaggedTokenIndexFeature<T>
      The index of a given token in the token sequence.
      class  PosTaggerHistoryAddressFunction
      Returns a pos-tagged token in the current history, at a position relative to the current token.
      class  VerbAspectFeature<T>
      The verb aspect of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  VerbMoodFeature<T>
      The verb mood of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  VerbTenseFeature<T>
      The tense of a given token as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  WordFormFeature<T>
      The actual text of a given token.

    • Uses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceDetector.features

      Subclasses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceDetector.features 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BoundaryStringFeature
      Returns the actual text of the possible sentence boundary being considered.
      class  InitialsFeature
      Returns true if the current token is "." and the previous token is a capital letter, false otherwise.
      class  InParenthesesFeature
      Returns "YES" if the current sentence break is between a "(" and ")" character without any intervening characters ".", "?" or "!".
      class  IsStrongPunctuationFeature
      Returns true if the current boundar is ".", "?" or "!".
      class  NextLetterCapitalFeature
      In the following descriptions, the current boundary is surrounded by square brackets.
      Returns "CapitalAfterInitial" for any pattern like: W[.] Shakespeare
      Returns "CapitalAfterQuote" for any pattern like: blah di blah[.] " Hello or blah di blah[.] "Hello
      Returns "CapitalAfterDash" for any pattern like: blah di blah[.] - Hello
      Returns "true" for any other pattern like: "blah di blah[.] Hello
      Returns "false" otherwise.
      Note that there MUST be whitespace between the separator and the capital letter for it to be considered a capital letter.
      class  NextLettersFeature
      Returns the n exact characters immediately following the current boundary.
      class  NextTokensFeature
      Returns the n atomic tokens immediately following the current boundary.
      class  PreviousLettersFeature
      Returns the n exact characters immediately preceding the current boundary.
      class  PreviousTokensFeature 
      class  SurroundingsFeature
      Examines the atomic tokens from n before the boundary to n after the boundary.
      For each token, if it is whitespace, adds " " to the result.
      If it is a separator, adds the original separator to the result.
      If it is a capitalised word, adds, "W", "Wo" or "Word", depending on whether the word is 1 letter, 2 letters, or more.
      Otherwise adds "word" to the result.

    • Uses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.features

      Subclasses of AbstractFeature in com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.features 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractTokenAddressFunction 
      class  AbstractTokenFeature<Y>
      An Abstract base class for intrinsic features.
      class  AndRangeFeature
      Tests all tokens within a certain range for a certain criterion, and returns true only if all of them satisfy the criterion.
      Start and end are absolute indexes.
      If either refer to a postion outside of the token sequence, will test all valid tokens only.
      If no tokens are tested, will return null.
      If any test returns null, will return null.
      class  CountIfFeature
      Counts the tokens within a certain range matching a certain criterion.
      The range is given in absolute indexes.
      If start > end, returns null.
      If no end is provided, assumes it should go till end of sentence.
      class  FirstWordInCompoundFeature
      Returns the first word in a compound token.
      class  FirstWordInSentenceFeature
      Returns true if this is the first word in the sentence.
      Will skip initial punctuation (e.g.
      class  HasClosedClassesOnlyFeature
      Returns true if all of this tokens classes in the lexicon are closed, false otherwise.
      class  HasFeature
      Returns true if the token refered to by address meets the boolean criterion.
      class  IfThenElseTokenAddressFeature 
      class  LastWordInCompoundFeature
      Retrieves the last word in a compound token.
      class  LastWordInSentenceFeature
      Returns true if this is the last word in the sentence (including punctuation).
      class  LemmaForPosTagFeature
      The "best" lemma of a given token and postag (or set of postags), as supplied by the lexicon.
      class  LexiconAllPosTagsFeature
      Returns a comma-separated concatenated string of all lexicon pos-tags for this token.
      class  LexiconPosTagFeature
      Returns true if the token has a lexical entry for any one of the PosTags provided.
      class  LexiconPosTagForStringFeature
      Returns true if the string provided has a lexicon entry for the PosTag provided.
      class  LexiconPosTagsFeature
      A StringCollectionFeature returning all of the postags for the current token in the lexicon.
      class  LexiconPosTagsForStringFeature
      A StringCollectionFeature returning all of the postags in the lexicon for a word specified by the wordToCheckFeature.
      class  NLetterPrefixFeature
      Retrieves the first N letters of the first entire word in the present token, as long as N < the length of the first entire word.
      class  NLetterSuffixFeature
      Retrieves the last N letters of the last entire word in the current token, as long as N < the length of the last word.
      class  OrRangeFeature
      Tests all tokens within a certain range for a certain criterion, and returns true if any one of them satisfies the criterion.
      Start and end are absolute indexes.
      If either refer to a postion outside of the token sequence, will test all valid tokens only.
      If no tokens are tested, will return null.
      If any test returns null, will return null.
      class  PatternGroupNameFeature
      The current pattern's group name.
      class  PatternIndexInSentenceFeature
      Returns the index of the first token matching this pattern.
      class  PatternMatchIndexInSentenceFeature
      Returns the index of the first token matching this pattern.
      class  PatternMatchOffsetAddressFunction
      Returns a token offset from the TokeniserPattern containing the present token.
      This allows us to find the word preceding a given compound candidate, or following a given compound candidate.
      Returns null if the offset goes outside the token sequence.
      class  PatternMatchWordFormFeature
      Returns the actual text of the tokens matching the current pattern.
      class  PatternNameFeature
      The current pattern's name.
      class  PatternOffsetAddressFunction
      Returns a token offset from the TokeniserPattern containing the present token.
      This allows us to find the word preceding a given compound candidate, or following a given compound candidate.
      Returns null if the offset goes outside the token sequence.
      class  PatternWordFormFeature
      Returns the actual text of the tokens matching the current pattern.
      class  PosTagSetFeature
      A StringCollectionFeature returning all of the postags in the current postagset.
      class  RegexFeature
      Returns true if the token matches a given regular expression.
      class  TokenAtAddressFunction
      Returns a token at a given absolute index, or null if the index is out of sentence range.
      class  TokenIndexFeature
      Returns the current token's index.
      class  TokeniserPatternsAndIndexesFeature
      A StringCollectionFeature returning all of the patterns in which the current token is not in position 0.
      class  TokeniserPatternsFeature
      A StringCollectionFeature returning all of the patterns started by the current token.
      class  TokenOffsetAddressFunction
      Returns a token offset from the current token by a certain offset.
      Returns null if the offset goes outside the token sequence.
      class  TokenWordFormFeature
      Simply returns the current token's text.
      class  UnknownWordFeature
      Returns true if the token is unknown in the lexicon.
      class  WordFeature
      Returns true if token word is any one of the words provided.
